bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Wash- ington, Western Division.
In the matter of the application of Moy Chong for a writ of habeas corpus
Gong Wa being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says:

That he has been a resident of Portland Oregon for over five years last past at about that buying into and attaining an interest in the merchandise firm of On Chong Wa & Co of which the above named Moy Chong is a member said firm being dealers in Chinese goods at 140 Second Street and he says that said Moy Chong is a member of said firm and has an interest therein as a member thereof in the of $2000. /100 two thousand dollars

is well and personally acquainted wit hsaid Moy Chong and knows that it was on or about the 10th day of March AD 1892 the said Moy Chong left the City of Portland for China with the intention of there making a visit with his relatives and also to ascertain the newest patterns and styles and prices of goods in their line of business and to make arrangements for purchasing said goods; that it has been this rule and custom of their said firm for the said respective partners to in their regular firm return to China for that purpose and taht when Moy Chung so left for China it was his firm togo and that he has now re- turned or to return on the Steamship Victoria; and that this deponent as partner of said Moy Chong did come to to appear vefore this United States Court to identify said Moy Chong and to the facts as recited in this said petition for a writ of habeas corpus are of much statements are the deponent and knowledge and that he has seen and recognized the said Moy Chong now as the charge of
the United States marshall and recognizes and knows him to be his said partner Moy Chong

Deponent hereto attaches a card of the said firm of which Moy Chong is a member as foresaid and deponent further that said Moy Chong is a good honest and bona fide merchant of the United States and has been for more than five years last past and deponent knows that he is a joint owner of said buisness as aforesaid and still a member of said firm and was a member of said firm before this deponent became a member thereof
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 4th day of June A.D. 1893
